div.pre: 2148 Sicily, c. 1935 (497) Burial: c. 310 B.C. (K) Contents: 58+ AR Pegasi Corinth: 33 (incl. all Per. V except Αϒ, ΔΟ) Ambracia: 2 Anactorium: 8 Argos: 2 Dyrrhachium: 1 Hipponium: 1 Leucas: 10 (1 with trident ctmk.) Unc.: 1 Disposition: Oxford 1 (unc.) Ravel, Numismatics 1936, pp. 1-7, illus. Noe attributed this hd. to Italy, but in a letter dated Aug. 14, 1935 Ravel writes "a few days ago they offered me from Sicily another parcel of 100 similar coins. I suppose they belong to the same find. On a coin of Dyr- rhachium there is dolphin under the Pegasos."
